Dialogue: I don't think we can do that.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: What I'm saying is she wouldn't go for that.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I don't know, Dignan. I just -- DIGNAN Look. I'm ready to get the fuck out of here. It's real torture for me to be here. Getting the shit kicked out of me by Mexicans.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: No one to back me up. Now I have a good idea. So unless you come up with something better --

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Dignan. I can't do that. All right? I just can't.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Then you better think of something.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I don't think we need any keys, Dignan. I think I can hotwire a car for us.

Dialogue: You don't know how to hotwire.

Speaker: anthony

Speaker: dignan

Dialogue: No, I'm serious. He made me a diagram.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: "I'll come back for you. I love you, Inez."

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: "I'm going to take you away from all this windexing and making beds."

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Man, I don't know anything about cars.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: You really know how to pick them.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I think we better go home.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: You can't just run home every time things get tough. First of all, we've got enough dough to --

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Our money situation is not good.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: You're so spoiled. What is "not good" to you? Only a few hundred --

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I had to give some to Inez.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: You gave $383 to the goddamn housekeeper! What the fuck is your problem?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Her name's Inez. Stop calling her the housekeeper.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: You're in love with the fucking housekeeper!

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: What are you going to do, get married? Have a bunch of little idiot janitor brats! And go around scrubbing the --

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: I'm not playing any more golf.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Cause I'm not getting any better. It's a waste of time.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: You've only been playing for two weeks, Bob. It takes a long time to learn this game.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Yes. You just got to stick with it.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: You don't have to talk about it if you don't want to.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: I know it must of been a bad experience. But it doesn't sound like it was your fault.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Well, I didn't mean to electrocute him. But the whole operation was my idea.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Even the school custodian Swifty thought it was great. He kept laughing and shaking his head the whole time he tried to disconnect the generator. And then suddenly  total silence except for Swifty hanging off the generator with his leg stuck to it being electrocuted.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Actually he died of a heart attack brought on by the shock. He was an older guy.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I felt terrible. I'd known Swifty since first grade. He was Dignan's medicine man for Indian Guides. They called each other Rattlesnake and Killer Whale. Whenever Dignan came to visit me he would act like he and Swifty weren't that good of friends, but that was just to make me feel better. The whole rest of the school had turned against me.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: At first they were going to charge me with manslaughter. That's partly why I was in custody so long. Sixty days.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Yeah. One minute you're studying Great Expectations and the next minute you're drawing the Holy Mary for some kid who tried to stab his girlfriend.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Why were you drawing the Holy Mary?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Prison tatoos. I got to be pretty good. It's not like drawing on paper.

Speaker: future man
Dialogue: Hard to find it sitting by the pool drinking beer and bullshitting.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I thought he didn't have to pay anything because of the technicality.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Yeah, but he still has the aggravation. Three days sitting in a cell.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Well, because you guys don't look alike.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: There's a lot of valuable shit in there, Applejack. The silver and the china. The crystal. And the grandfather clock. Goddammit, I bet that clock's worth ten grand.

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: Why the fuck do we need to blow up the car? It doesn't make any goddamn sense.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Just settling an old score. You might say revenge.

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: That sounds like a lot of bullshit that'll land us in jail.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: We might have to take that chance. Cause I feel pretty strongly about this.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Looks like he's staying with Buckethead. That's what I figured. He's probably got his own room. Let's see where he's going.

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: We're going too slow. It looks like we're following him.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: That's Applejack. You want to meet him?

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: I hear you're a good thief.

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: I'm just sitting at this bar drinking my drink when this fine chick walks by. She was a living doll. And the big motherfucker who came in with her sees me looking, when he walks by he steps on my foot. Doesn't say shit. Just takes a seat with his lady. Well, I holler out to him, If I was as big as you, ain't no way in the hell you'd of stepped on my foot like that. He just laughed. He says, Little man, take your foot and put it in your pocket. I said, No, how about I take my foot and I stick it up your ass? Man, we went to war right there. I hit him so hard I knocked his nuts in his watchpocket. But this motherfucker wouldn't go down. Then all the sudden, out of nowhere, Dignan came up behind him and smashed a bottle on his head. And that big old boy went down. That's how I met Dignan. Good cat to have on your side. He'll go to war with you. He don't give a fuck.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Applejack would of got him anyway. This was just the quicker war.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: You really hit a guy with a bottle?

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Pretty much. He kind of fell into me. But wait a second.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: I want you to look at this.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: It's big, Anthony. Real big. It's called Hinckley Cold Storage.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Mr. Henry has an inside source. We call him Steve. That's where we get our information.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: You'll meet him this afternoon. He's helping us set it up.

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: Did you ever hear of the S. Cooper Trust robbery?

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Mr. Henry pulled that job in 1965. It's famous. Applejack was the wheel man. Did you use this same car, Applejack?

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: Hell, no. This is a '72. I was driving a '63 Pontiac. ANTHONY What exactly is this place? Freezers?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: What time did he say to be here?

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: I can knock a man out with a six inch punch.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: You could give somebody a concussion.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: This is Anthony Adams, Mr. Henry.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: It's hard to get much spin with this kind of paddle.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: I don't know. Are you in, Anthony?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I'd like to live in that place. Hinckley Cold Storage.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: So what do you think of the plan, Mr. Kumar?

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: We'd love to have you on the team.

Speaker: bob

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: It's too bad about what happened on the road.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Let's not even talk about it.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: I don't expect an apology and I don't even want one. I just want us to --

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: I can't fucking believe this guy. An apology, Bob?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Man, I don't want to go into this.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Cause you would of let my brother rot in jail.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: I don't want to fight you, Dignan.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Dignan, we're friends. Take it easy.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: No fighting. It wasn't Bob's fault.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: It wasn't your fault, Bob. You had your brother. BOB I didn't have any choice.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: What the fuck are we doing out here?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I don't know, Dignan. You went crazy.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Look. We want you on the job.

Dialogue: This boy's a troublemaker. He used to tear this place apart.

Dialogue: Your brother was up here the other day. He said you ran away from home.

Speaker: jackson
Dialogue: He said you ran away from home.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: No. I didn't run away. I went out of town.

Dialogue: John Mapplethorpe.  How are you. Hi.

Dialogue: Jackson says you told him I ran away from home.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: John, I'm twenty-six years old I didn't run away from home.

Speaker: future man
Dialogue: I know, Bob. You were on a secret mission.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: I'd appreciate it if you didn't go around telling people lies about me.

Speaker: future man
Dialogue: Right. I'm sorry.  You've got a reputation to think about.

Dialogue: Well, we'll see you later, Bob.

Dialogue: OK. Man in blue jeans just left by southwest door. He is entering a white van. What time is it?

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: God. Isn't this great? Working on the job. Got a wheel man. Got a safecracker. Good friends with Mr. Henry.

Dialogue: I'm not really sure. I think it's Irish. Or maybe --

Dialogue: What do you mean what kind of person? He's a good person.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: And you're wrong if you think, I'd turn my back on a friend.

Dialogue: Is my car OK out there?

Dialogue: I don't know why the fuck we're having a party. The damn job's not over yet.

Dialogue: Well, this isn't really a party per se.

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: You don't celebrate til it's over.

Speaker: applejack
Dialogue: What the fuck are you doing?

Dialogue: Yeah. I mean, I don't think about it all the time. But once in awhile I kind of go, Woah. Man.

Dialogue: Are you afraid to die, Mr. Henry?

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Is that sugarless gum you're chewing?

Dialogue: If someone could copy my life story. If I had someone, man, to just write what I talk. I have so many stories. Bestseller, man.

Dialogue: I've been all over the Goddamn country. I've seen things.

Dialogue: I used to go to Vegas and do headstands.

Dialogue: I know it, man. Hang on.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Give him a second. BOB Hopscotch. The code name is hopscotch.

Dialogue: We're just going over a few things.

Dialogue: Can I ask you something, Mr. Henry?

Dialogue: Why'd you want to help us?

Dialogue: Next week we'll be drinking pia coladas.

Dialogue: Hopefully this trip'll go a little smoother than the last one.

Dialogue: Or I might end up with a broken nose.

Dialogue: I'll try not to hold you back tomorrow.

Dialogue: I don't want to be too much of a liability.

Dialogue: Look, you're going to do fine. It's OK to be scared.

Dialogue: I don't think I ever said this to you. But it meant a lot to me the way you were after that Swifty stuff happened.

Dialogue: No, I'm having a heart attack. Of course, I'm OK. What's that supposed to mean?

Dialogue: I'll take one of those, too, please.

Dialogue: Bird Dog to Scarecrow. Bird Dog to Scarecrow.

Dialogue: He's going to watch the back stairwell, remember?  Don't worry about it.

Dialogue: Not at all. The place is totally deserted.

Dialogue: I've got a great view up here. I can see all the --

Dialogue: Jacknife. Come in, Jacknife.  Hello? Bob? Are you there?

Dialogue: Bob? What the fuck is going on? Anthony? Who's in the elevator?

Dialogue: Let me see it.  Did you drop it?

Dialogue: It was Bob. His walkie talkie's busted.

Dialogue: Who's watching the door? What the fuck are you doing? Get back in position.

Dialogue: Who did that? What the fuck is that?

Dialogue: Jesus Christ.  What the fuck is that?

Dialogue: I didn't think there was an alarm.

Dialogue: Take him to the car, Bob.

Dialogue: It's the fire alarm.  Somebody pulled the fire alarm.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, Anthony.  Did you lose him?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: What were you doing in there?

Dialogue: What the fuck happened to the the plan?

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Yes, there is. Let's get organized.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: I'm not going to do anything.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: I said to the DA, That cop who hit me must of given me CRS disease.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: That's just what the DA asked. CRS is a disease where you can't remember shit.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: Tell Mr. Henry I said that.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: So is Mr. Henry going to come by and see me or anything?

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: I don't think so. I mean. Actually, he robbed Bob's house.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: You got to be kidding me.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: We haven't heard from Applejack since he got out of the hospital. His case got dismissed.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: His health isn't very good, you know. They take that into account.

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: Mr. Henry never gave you a test, did he?

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: How big is it? ANTHONY Oh, I'd say about --

Speaker: anthony
Dialogue: We're not sure yet. It's going to need some repairs.

Dialogue: So how is it in there?

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: What can I say? It's jail. You don't sleep when you want to. You don't eat when you want to.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Do you have your own room?

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: We don't have rooms, Bob. We have cells.

Speaker: bob
Dialogue: Do you have your own cell?

Dialogue: No. I have a cellmate. His name's Carl.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: I don't really want to talk about it, Bob.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: This sure beats the shit out of the shit they crap out in this joint.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: I might have to have another one of these.

Speaker: dignan
Dialogue: I think I may have found a way out of here.

Dialogue: When we go through the next gate you'll have 30 seconds to take out the tower guard.
